SGCCRfC Wiki

Finite Difference Method (FDM)

The Finite Difference Method approximates derivatives by discretizing the domain into grids and replacing differential operators with algebraic differences.

ğŸ“ Key Concepts

  • Forward, backward, central differences
  • Explicit vs implicit schemes
  • Stability (CFL condition)
  • Time-marching methods
  • Grid discretization (uniform & non-uniform)
  • Error analysis & truncation error

PDE solvers for teaching/learning.

Devito

High-performance finite difference DSL for wave propagation.
ğŸ”— https://github.com/devitocodes/devito

Seismic processing and FDM tools.
ğŸ”— https://github.com/ahay/RSF
